yeah, you want to dpkg -S `which bkl-investigator`, it'll tell you what package its part of, then you can apt-get remove that.
but it's probably a better idea to remove whatever installed it as a dep and then apt-get autoremove.
it also indexes thumbnails, just like ~/.thumbnails ... i really don't think need this extra service

regardless, most things don't like it when you rip dependencies out from under them. I'd suggest disabling whatever it does in whatever package installed it. I don't know how to display deptrees with apt, but I bet somebody in here does.
